      • read

        public Signal read()
        Description copied from interface: DigitalInput
        Reads the current signal on the pin.
        Specified by:
        read in interface DigitalInput
        Returns:
        the signal - either low or high

      • readDebounced

        public Signal readDebounced(int debounceMilliseconds)
        Description copied from interface: DigitalInput
        Reads the signal on the pin debounced. This is useful if one needs to read a bouncing state transition. It does so by continuously reading the input and after it had a number of stable reads it returns the read value.
        Specified by:
        readDebounced in interface DigitalInput
        Parameters:
        debounceMilliseconds - this is the time that is used for debouncing in the worst case. When the input is still bouncing after the specified period, then the return value will not be reliable.
        Returns:
        the signal that was read from the pin - either low or high

      • disableInterrupts

        public void disableInterrupts()
        Description copied from interface: DigitalInput
        This method disables interrupt events on this input. When interrupt events are disabled, then edges on the pins won't trigger the InterruptListener's interruptRequest method.
        Specified by:
        disableInterrupts in interface DigitalInput

      • enableInterrupts

        public void enableInterrupts()
        Description copied from interface: DigitalInput
        This method enables interrupt events on this input.
        Specified by:
        enableInterrupts in interface DigitalInput

      • areInterruptsEnabled

        public boolean areInterruptsEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: DigitalInput
        This method checks whether interrupts are currently enabled. If they are enabled, interrupt events will be handled. disableInterrupts() to disable interrupts and DigitalInput.enableInterrupts() to enable them.
        Specified by:
        areInterruptsEnabled in interface DigitalInput
        Returns:
        true, if interrupt requests are currently handled, false otherwise.

      • setInterruptDebounceMs

        public void setInterruptDebounceMs(int milliSeconds)
        Description copied from interface: DigitalInput
        If the edges of interrupts should be debounced before calling the interrupt event handlers, then the maximum time that should be used for debouncing can be specified here. When the input is still bouncing after the specified period, then the return value will not be reliable. However, please note that this is the maximum time taken. If the input can stably be read earlier, then it won't take as long. The interrupt will then trigger only once instead of multiple times on a bouncing input.
        Specified by:
        setInterruptDebounceMs in interface DigitalInput
        Parameters:
        milliSeconds - The maximum time that is used for debouncing

      • getInterruptDebounceMs

        public int getInterruptDebounceMs()
        Description copied from interface: DigitalInput
        Returns the maximum time that is used for debouncing interrupts.
        Specified by:
        getInterruptDebounceMs in interface DigitalInput
        Returns:
        The maximum time that is used for debouncing.

      • setInterruptTrigger

        public void setInterruptTrigger(Edge edge)
        Description copied from interface: DigitalInput
        Sets the interrupt trigger. This is the Edge that is used for interrupt detection. Interrupts can either trigger on a rising edge, a falling edge, or on both edges. The default value is both edges.
        Specified by:
        setInterruptTrigger in interface DigitalInput
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge that is used for triggering interrupts on this input.

        Description copied from interface: DigitalInput

      • startBlinking

        public void startBlinking(int periodLengthMilliseconds)
        Description copied from interface: DigitalOutput
        This method is used to let the pin blink indefinitely. It is a non blocking method that will be executed asynchronously. To stop the blinking, see the stopBlinking() method. You can specify the duration of a blinking period. A blinking period is the full cycle of a state transition and includes the the high phase as well as the low phase. Both phases have the same duration.
        Specified by:
        startBlinking in interface DigitalOutput
        Parameters:
        periodLengthMilliseconds - the duration of one full blinking period in milliseconds

      • startBlinking

        public void startBlinking(int periodLengthMilliseconds,
                 int durationMilliseconds)
        Description copied from interface: DigitalOutput
        This method is used to let the pin blink for a specified duration. It is a non blocking method that will be executed asynchronously.To stop the blinking prematurely, see the stopBlinking() method. You can specify the duration of a blinking period. A blinking period is the full cycle of a state transition and includes the the high phase as well as the low phase. Both phases have the same duration. Also, you can specify the duration of the whole blinking process, e.g. specify to let the output blink for 3000 milliseconds.
        Specified by:
        startBlinking in interface DigitalOutput
        Parameters:
        periodLengthMilliseconds - the duration of one full blinking period in milliseconds
        durationMilliseconds - the duration of the whole blinking process in milliseconds. A value of 0 let's it blink indefinitely.

      • blinkTimes

        public void blinkTimes(int periodLengthMilliseconds,
              int times)
        Description copied from interface: DigitalOutput
        This method is used to let the input blink a number of times.
        Specified by:
        blinkTimes in interface DigitalOutput
        Parameters:
        periodLengthMilliseconds - the duration of one full blinking period in milliseconds
        times - the amount of times the output should blink
